ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] I'm playing again
ygData.msgSnippet: Sever politics hits when you get to higher levels.  It has to do with scheduling raids, loot rules, etc.  Once the server matures to a certain point there are
ygData.messageBody:
Sever politics hits when you get to higher levels.  It has to do with scheduling raids, loot rules, etc.  Once the server matures to a certain point there are more people wanting to go on raids than spots to accomodate them.  On Brell it was at the point that guilds camped the boards to be the first person to sign up for the next raid right as the clock rolled over.  Then there are cliques of people who won't play with people.  There's fighting about loot (I think that is the worst - I HATE it so much). 
 
By 50 everyone knows everyone else.  People have formed friends and enemies and your reputation makes a HUGE difference (HUGE!!!!) in how you get to play. 
 
Ice
----- Original Message -----
From: P MacKinnon
To: 'EQ_women@egroups.com'
Cc: Christina Norman
Sent: Friday, January 12, 2001 7:18 AM
Subject: RE: [EQ_women] I'm playing again

A newbie question re server politics; what are they?  Are there different 'cultures' on different servers?  Is this a guild thing?  Is there something I should look out for?  <gulp>

patti


I've gone back to my old server to visit and that's nice, I always run
into some old friends who say hi and chat with me. There are people I
still care about on that old server. But, it seems like I have a barrier
that prevents me from playing there. I just know if I play there that
server politics will rear its ugly head again.

So for now I will power level my little enchanter on Tholuxe, and see what
it's like playing there.

Christina
